code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @param {Integer} m
# @return {Boolean}
def can_split_array(nums, m)
  # Helper function to check if the array can be split into valid subarrays
  def dfs(subarray, m)
    # Base case: if subarray length is 1, it's always valid
    return true if subarray.length == 1

    # Try to split the subarray at every possible index
    (1...subarray.length).each do |i|
      left = subarray[0...i]
      right = subarray[i..-1]

      # Check if both left and right subarrays satisfy the conditions
      if (left.length == 1 || left.sum >= m) && (right.length == 1 || right.sum >= m)
        # If both subarrays are valid, check if further splits are possible/needed
        return true if dfs(left, m) && dfs(right, m)
      end
    end

    # If no valid split is found, return false
    false
  end

  # Initial call to the helper function with the entire array
  dfs(nums, m)
end
